publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2141# Cathie Craigie: Eco Schools Programme—That the Parliament recognises the importance of education in raising environmental awareness; notes the continuing and growing success of the Eco Schools programme, run in Scotland by Keep Scotland Beautiful; encourages the Scottish Executive to give continued support to the programme, and congratulates Whitelees Primary School in Cumbernauld on being the 100th school in Scotland to be awarded a Green Flag.

S2M-2141# Cathie Craigie: Eco Schools Programme—That the Parliament recognises the importance of education in raising environmental awareness; notes the continuing and growing success of the Eco Schools programme, run in Scotland by Keep Scotland Beautiful; encourages the Scottish Executive to give continued support to the programme, and congratulates Whitelees Primary School in Cumbernauld on being the 100th school in Scotland to be awarded a Green Flag. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Pringle*, Robert Brown*, Patrick Harvie*, Rosie Kane*, Sarah Boyack*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Shiona Baird*, Scott Barrie*, Bill Butler*

S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Bruce Crawford*, Helen Eadie*, Robin Harper*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Christine May*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Alex Neil*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Trish Godman*, Elaine Smith*, Ms Sandra White*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) John Swinburne*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Linda Fabiani*

S2M-2141# Cathie Craigie: Eco Schools Programme—That the Parliament recognises the importance of education in raising environmental awareness; notes the continuing and growing success of the Eco Schools programme, run in Scotland by Keep Scotland Beautiful; encourages the Scottish Executive to give continued support to the programme, and congratulates Whitelees Primary School in Cumbernauld on being the 100th school in Scotland to be awarded a Green Flag. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Eleanor Scott, Mike Pringle, Robert Brown, Patrick Harvie, Rosie Kane, Sarah Boyack, Ms Wendy Alexander, Shiona Baird, Scott Barrie, Bill Butler, Jackie Baillie, Chris Ballance, Bruce Crawford, Helen Eadie, Robin Harper, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Christine May, Dr Elaine Murray, Alex Neil, Marilyn Livingstone, Mr Jamie Stone, Trish Godman, Elaine Smith, Ms Sandra White, Karen Whitefield, John Swinburne, Nora Radcliffe, Linda Fabiani
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Margaret Jamieson*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Mary Scanlon*, Dennis Canavan*, Susan Deacon*
S2M-2141# Eco Schools Programme (lodged on 9 December 2004) Mike Watson*
